Intervention: Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), day 1 and day 8 every 21 days until disease progression.
Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days until disease progression
Eligibility: * Chinese patients whose diagnosis of breast cancer is histologically or cytologically proven.
A non-resectable, locally recurring breast cancer or stage IV disease.
Have at least one measurable lesion as defined by the criteria for assessing response in solid tumours (RECIST).
• Performance status of 0 or 1 on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) scale
Treatment with chemotherapy based on anthracycline in the adjuvant/neoadjuvant setting with relapse of the disease.
Prior chemotherapy for breast cancer or non-resectable metastatic disease, locally advanced.
Simultaneous administration of any other tumour therapy, including cytotoxic chemotherapy, hormonal therapy and immunotherapy.
A known or suspected brain metastasis or second primary malignancy that is clinically detectable at the time of enrolment in the study.
- An active infection or other serious condition.
Results: The best response recorded from the start of treatment to the progression or recurrence of the disease using the solid tumour response assessment criteria (RECIST), which defines when participants improve ("response"), remain the same ("stable") or worsen (" progression") during treatment.

Time: start of progressive disease measured (student tumour assessments were performed every 2 cycles during study treatment, or 3 months after treatment until disease progression, or up to 12 months after registration)
Description of the arm/group: Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), day 1 and day 8 every 21 days until disease progression.
Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days until disease progression
Unit of Measure: Participants Complete Response (CR): 2
Early deaths due to malignant disease: 0
